security: Revealing details about FBI informants and their reliability could compromise ongoing investigations and endanger the informant's safety. Quoting directly: 'Because of the informant'a sensitive position in organized crine, our Los Angeles, California, Office requests the information be dealt with in strict confidence.'
summary: An FBI memo reports on William Alexander Parzow, a figure allegedly involved in influence peddling, and his connections to organized crime. The memo relays information from a reliable informant regarding Parzow's activities and claims of association with prominent individuals.
summary_one_paragraph: This FBI memo, dated February 1, 1972, from the Director to the Attorney General, details information received from a reliable informant (LA 4711-C-TE) concerning William Alexander Parzow, also known as William Aspaini Parzow and Abie Williams, who is suspected of influence peddling and having ties to organized crime. The memo notes that Parzow was reportedly visiting his son-in-law in Rialto, California, and claims connections to Murray M. Chotiner, Edward Bennett Williams, and William G. Hundley. Parzow allegedly discussed assisting in the release of Manuel Ricky Jacobs and possessed Federal Grand Jury transcripts related to election law violations. The FBI is not conducting an investigation at this time without a specific request from the Department of Justice.
title: Information Concerning William Alexander Parzow
